artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Iseya Kanekichi; Carver: Yokogawa Takejirō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: portrait of woman with grimacing expression; PR eye is drooping and grey; figure bent severely downward, with head in LLQ of image; woman holds a strand of her long hair in her PL hand; woman wears grey kimono and wide blue sash; flames above and below woman's head; shadowy trees in ULQ
inscription: in the red rectangle: {Rui no bōrei} | Toshiyuki\'s poem: {Aki kinu to / Me ni wa sayaka ni / Mie ne domo / Kaze no oto ni zo / Odoroka re nu ru} (When autumn came / My eyes clearly / Could not see it, yet / In the sound of the wind / I felt it.)
markings: censor seals: {Hama} | {Magome} | (Rat 9) | publisher\'s seal: {Isekane} | carver\'s seal: {hori Take}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Visual Parody of the Thirty-Six Selected Poets (Mitate sanjūrokkasen no uchi 見立三十六歌撰之内)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
title: Fujiwara no Toshiyuki's Poem and the Ghost of Rui
